author: Rebecca Knight
title: Wenger sends message to Xhaka about shocking red card record
text:
Wenger sends message to Xhaka about shocking red card record By Rebecca Knight   Not impressed 
Arsene Wenger is well known for defending his players and ‘not seeing’ things that might get them into trouble – but he didn’t mince his words when it came to Granit Xhaka. 
The player was sent off for the second time this season, and now has nine red cards in the last three years – something Wenger has admitted needs to change. 
He said : “He has to control his game, and not punish the team with his lack of control and his tackling. 
“We don’t encourage our midfielders to go down in tackles, we want them to stand up and not make these kind of fouls. 
“So if it is a bad tackle then it is a red card.” In the title race 
Chelsea may have won and gone eight points clear, but Arsenal are playing them on Saturday, and will hope to repeat their massive win over the Blues earlier in the season. 
With Chelsea also set to play Liverpool in the same week, a couple of results could see the title race blown wide open – or over totally, and Arsene Wenger will be well aware of that. 
To be out the title race by the middle of February will not be something the Arsenal manager – or fans – will want, and beating the Blues come Saturday lunchtime is a must. Loading tags...
